entry.title: If I could Avoid...I would!

link.title: Organisation commented on
Learning disability health check
If I could Avoid...I would!
Original comment on NHS Choices website
Report this comment as offensive or unsuitable

category.label: Whether this is a comment, reply or deletion

content.div:
Always on time! i turn up 20mins before my appointment (think this is more than enough time). Then sat down. Waited over 45mins after my appointment and then I had to ask how long and they said he hadn't arrived?!
If i didn't get up, then nothing would have happened! This maybe their working place but we have to work too. I now have to work back the time I wasted and then work back the time for an actual appointment when they are on time.
I understand people can be late, but it would nice if you mentioned it.

rating.questionText: Are you able to get through to the surgery by telephone?
Are you able to get an appointment when you want one?
Do the staff treat you with dignity and respect?
Does the surgery involve you in decisions about your care and treatment?

entry.title: Medical staff excellent, receptionists let practice down

link.title: Organisation commented on
Learning disability health check
Medical staff excellent, receptionists let practice down
Original comment on NHS Choices website
Report this comment as offensive or unsuitable

category.label: Whether this is a comment, reply or deletion

content.div:
I, along with most of my family, have been registered at this practice all of our lives. The doctors and nurses are very helpful and informative and I feel at ease if I have to visit with a problem.
I find the reception staff let the practice down. It is often very difficult to get an answer on the phone, and on occasion have found them abrupt, and when you arrive at the booth you will be waiting whilst they chat and will avoid eye contact with you. Perhaps this isn't all of the receptionist but it does make it frustrating when they are in essence the gateway to getting an appointment.
I have had a few minor problems where I have waited well over half an hour after my appointment time to be seen (I have always been on time), however I believe this is other patients faults and not that of the medical staff.
On one occasion I did hear some staff discussing the state of a patients home very loudly on the corridor. They were talking to each other from a short distance and going into detail of the condition this person was living in and I found this very unprofessional and would have been mortified if that was a relative or friend of mine.

rating.questionText: Are you able to get through to the surgery by telephone?

entry.title: Excellent Doctors and Staff who listen and care.

link.title: Organisation commented on
Learning disability health check
Excellent Doctors and Staff who listen and care.
Original comment on NHS Choices website
Report this comment as offensive or unsuitable

category.label: Whether this is a comment, reply or deletion

content.div: I have been under the care of my GP for many years, as were my parents. They have treated us with respect and professional care of the utmost value. I find this true of the other GP also, as I have been under their treatment in recent times. Both Doctors considerately afford you human dignity. They listen and explain their diagnosis and reasons for such. They are very patient when doing so. The staff are welcoming and supportive. I consider myself fortunate in being under the auspecies of this G.P. surgery.

link.title: Organisation commented on
Learning disability health check
staff
Original comment on NHS Choices website
Report this comment as offensive or unsuitable

category.label: Whether this is a comment, reply or deletion

content.div: I am fed up of hearing bad comments about the staff at this surgery, I have never had a problem with them at all, in fact, I have always found them really helpful, re- fitting me in for appointments around my work shifts, I'm not saying mistakes have never happened but I am saying when they have the staff have always sorted things out.

entry.title: the doctors are brilliant, reception staff let it down

link.title: Organisation commented on
Learning disability health check
the doctors are brilliant, reception staff let it down
Original comment on NHS Choices website
Report this comment as offensive or unsuitable

category.label: Whether this is a comment, reply or deletion

content.div: The doctors are brilliant. Very helpful and investigate your problems and worries properly. Couldnt fault the doctors at all. Its just a shame about the reception staff, never answer the phone and always seem to busy chit chatting between their selves when they have patients waiting and phones to answer. They always seem likr your wasting their time. The doctors are really good though and thats the only reason ive not changed doctors/surgery.

entry.title: Extremely rude receptionists & wont answer the phones.

link.title: Organisation commented on
Learning disability health check
Extremely rude receptionists & wont answer the phones.
Original comment on NHS Choices website
Report this comment as offensive or unsuitable

category.label: Whether this is a comment, reply or deletion

content.div: This surgery is run by the most unprofessional, rude and aggressive staff I have ever dealt with. When I phone to make an appointment I am greeted by an extremely rude person at reception who berates me for not phoning between the 8.30am-8.31am narrow window when they actually bother to answer the phones. The rest of the time the phone just rings out until someone answers and immediately disconnects it. I recently made the mistake of assuming my Dr would be ok to sign a medical form for a job interview I had - they charged me £90 for the trouble and didnt bother completing the form (signing their name only) for two weeks. This resulted in my start date being delayed, and again when I phoned through to chase the form up I received bad attitude and rudeness for daring to ask very standard questions ie "when can i pick my form up?". The staff here genuinely seem to believe they are godlike beings and act as if you are a lower form of life if you dare to take up their time or make them work for their salaries. Appalling treatment of patients, and totally horrendous and unprofessional attitude on every occasion.

content.div: My named GP is one of the best and has been my doctor for some time! I have always found the staff to be very good respectful and polite, "and I have seen quite a few staff come and go over the years" Not to sure about the other doctors as I don't see them. I for 1 am very grateful to them for the service I have received,

entry.title: Should be closed down

link.title: Organisation commented on
Learning disability health check
Should be closed down
Original comment on NHS Choices website
Report this comment as offensive or unsuitable

category.label: Whether this is a comment, reply or deletion

content.div: This place is a disgrace, 10 staff seem to be doing a job that could be managed by 4, some of the staff's attitude is disgusting, I suffer from Cardiomyopathy (heart failure) & have never been asked to come in for any checkups or blood tests for my condition since I was discharged from hospital over 3 years ago, 18 months ago I went to see Dr with a blister like spot on my arm & was told it was "nothing to worry about" I did worry & had it checked again this year by Dr who referred me to hospital to see a specialist who told me it was a serious form of skin cancer & needed an operation to have it removed. The best people in there are the nurses who are very helpful. I have now started to have problems getting my medication from them & cant cope with it anymore, I feel more ill coming out of there than I do going in, so much so that I am changing my GP & surgery after Christmas.
